corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value: Identification of item, date; Esta Nette Papers; TAM 525; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Lynne Turner by in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.003.

Esta Nette (Feb 25, 1921 - Jun 7, 2008), was a lifelong activist. She was a one-time member of the Young Pioneers, a youth group affiliated with the Communist Party USA, and was involved in the Labor-Negro Vanguard Conference, a New Jersey-based grouping that emerged from the Communist Party. Her father was a fur worker.

1. Blue memory book from P.S. 225 with many inscriptions from fellow Young Pioneers, Winter of 1934; 2. Membership card and monthly stamp book, Hotel and Restaurant Employees and Bartenders Union Local 611, Asbury Park, NJ from 1952-1957; 3. World Citizen identity card, 3/31/1962; 4. Program of cultural evening of Labor-Negro Vanguard conference to celebrate Negro History Week, Feb 15, 1963; 5. Election leaflet, ca. 1966: Esta Nette and other comrades and friends from the Labor Negro Vanguard Conference (such as Clarence Coggins, brother-in-law Ernie Stapleton, Alvin Oliver, etc.) running for political office on progressive, anti-war slate. Esta ran for Essex County NJ Freeholder (and lost!); 6. Appreciation certificate awarded to Nette by the United Community Corporation of Newark, NJ on Jul 25, 1967 (soon after the Newark riots occurred in the Central Ward where Nette lived); 7. Program of the American Trade Union Delegation visit to Poland, September, 1978; 8. Essex County College Human Services Luncheon, May, 1981: Esta presented with Mental Health Certificate for classes taken at ECC (While also working with City of Newark Office of Community Organization); 9. Invitation to Nette to event for Pastors for Peace delegation while a participant in Pastors for Peace Caravan to Cuba in March, 1994; 10. Newspaper article from <emph render="italic">El Tiempo Latino</emph>, Mar 24, 1995, of Justice for Janitors protest in Washington, DCC (Nette in photo at left under heading being pulled by police with granddaughter Lynne Turner); 11. Program from Global Exchange "Millenium" Reality Tour to Cuba, taken by Nette with Turner from 12/29/1999 to 1/4/2000; 12. Delegate's tag for "Forum Syndical," People's Summit of the Americas, during protests against Free Trade Area of the Americas in Quebec City in April, 2001; 13. Newspaper article from <emph render="italic">Home News Tribune</emph> with photo of Nette and other peace activists during March of 2003 protest against the Iraq war, in New Brunswick, NJ; 14. Memorial photo collage of Nette prepared following her death.

corpname.value: Communist Party of the United States of America. Young Pioneers
